messages.message: just curious — in general how often are people able to get their cypress tests passing? When I run them I pretty much always have failures and they’re all for different reasons, it’s very hard to get a passing run. It doesn’t seem like this is the case with the runs on aihub-sandbox so maybe this is just solved by adding the retries like we discussed in yesterdays guild meeting?
the retries have already been added
@Arjun what types of errors are you seeing? I wonder if it's an issue with stability of crafting sandboxes versus aihub-sandbox

this run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9938/overview/2fa4a601-98d5-4ba0-b570-038d1753b684?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1) failed for many different reasons, a lot of which were failed to upload files so yes points to some sandbox instability
this run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9934/overview/cbfe677c-8baf-4f52-abbd-f476f58ee124?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1) I think failed bc converse digitization took too long? not sure but it’s weird that other tests weren’t affected
this run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9929/overview?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1) failed because there was a loading state that took too long
there were more yesterday that were similarly flaky — it’s difficult because every run is a different reason and a different set of tests so I’m not sure what to do other than just keep retrying
Darn that last one was so close! That was the one you and Serena were thinking about increasing the timeout for right?
And then the converse one was one that was also pointed out in the channel as flaky, and then the first run where so much failed was the issue we're trying to resolve with the crafting team I think
yeah, but I think we can just remove that part of the test as it should be covered by some other spec

So there are explanations and resolutions for each of these. I think we should keep chipping away at these as they come up. It feels random, but there are patterns and things we can do, as frustrating as it is
yeah, I agree on these 3. I have some examples from yesterday that feel less explainable, let me find and link here

this one (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9865/overview/87a6d610-777d-4d28-bf1e-23c1646fa701?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1) is really interesting — everytime I try to watch the test replay the page crashes, no idea if that is related
and this one (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9873/overview/a4619efb-4359-4a19-be52-1f830c485c24?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1) I have no idea what’s going on
That first one is super weird! I have no idea
The second one seems like another sandbox issue...
oh actually retries don't repeat the before all block so hm
https://github.com/cypress-io/cypress/issues/19458
it looks like there's workarounds discussed in that thread... i don't have bandwidth to look into this rn but yeah
I'll give it a shot

One thing to keep in mind is that even with fixing the before hook to run before retries, we'll have to make sure that successive test runs don't depend on previous test runs passing (which is how it's recommended to be, we just don't always follow it). When a test case fails, it retries only that test, not the entire suite, so if it depends on state from a previous test, it will fail again.
for most of the build tests, at least, there's only a single test per describe block
I finally got my tests to pass but I have to rebase bc of https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C035SLYCJ9X/p1715879451339599 :lolcry:

same... i rarely got Cypress to pass on the first time (even if my code doesn't touch any build/converse/app run UI). I usually check other test runs and see the same problem so that I'm sure it's not my PR broke the test. Then, I just keep on retrying endlessly...
Let's see if the retries help, I'll have my PR ready in not too long
